intro: Hieracium caesitium, commonly known as the blue hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its bright blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium caesitium is often found in open habitats and can spread through rhizomes, forming dense colonies.
